item.title: Run PowerShell Script with Windows Task Scheduler
item.description:
More ore less quick note for myself - on how to run a PowerShell Script using Windows Task Scheduler.

Open Task Scheduler

A quick way to open Task Scheduler: WIN + R, then run taskschd.msc.

Create New Task

Open “Task Scheduler Library” â†’ “Create New Task”. Set all the self-explanatory options like Name, Description, User Account, Triggers, etc.
